document_data.name: Starfall Pool
document_data.mainbody: '''''Starfall Pool''''' was a ballad by an unknown composer about the [[Starfall Pool|glade]] and [[Starfall Pool (pond)|pond]] of the same name located north of [[Silverymoon]] just past the edge of the [[Moonwood]]. It described a place of restful healing, a dancing [[dryad]], and strange dreams. This song was famous throughout [[Luruar]] by the {{YearlinkName|1372}}.{{Cite dragon/296/Elminster's Guide to the Realms: Starfall Pool|74}}
document_data.Contents:
The ballad was long, and there were many versions. It usually went on to describe the healing of mind and body or meeting fair folk, [[humans]] and [[half-elves]], in deep dreams of joyous recreation, courtship, or humorous exploits, but other versions hinted at dark magic with a [[siren]]'s lure, or an evil [[wizard]] that threatened the glade or the dryad. But each verse was followed by the well-known refrain: {{Quote| There is a place in the deep green wood
Where the dryad [[Olsheirie]] dwells
Dancing where a keep once stood
Girt with magic of chiming bells.

Refrain:
Though to stray so deep is the act of a fool
I regret no stride toward Starfall Pool.

Came I there by happy chance
And there I'll thither go again
To dream more dreams of fair romance
For by the pool I know no pain.

(Refrain)

Trees old and green, dark and still
Ring 'round an oak as old as time
Fall down keep and rise up hill
Rest and hear the dryad rhyme.

(Refrain)

Kindled by the dying embers
Of a fire that must not stay
Magic soars and then remembers
Warding me again away.

(Refrain)

Back I'll go when I am able
Though long rides may lie between
Peace again upon my table
Lying on the moss so green. |From "Starfall Pool"}}
